actor_awards.notes: Comedic legend known for her 'logic of the illogical' persona and her successful partnership with husband George Burns. She received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame for Television in 1960.

filmography.title: The Gracie Allen Murder Case
filmography.role_description: A scatterbrained chatterbox who stumbles into a murder investigation and 'helps' Philo Vance solve it.
filmography.plot: Philo Vance investigates a murder where the primary witness and source of confusion is the dizzy Gracie Allen.

filmography.title: Mr. and Mrs. North
filmography.role_description: A dizzy but intuitive housewife who discovers a body in her apartment and tries to solve the crime.
filmography.plot: A husband and wife return home to find a corpse in their apartment and must identify the killer to clear their names.

filmography.title: A Damsel in Distress
filmography.role_description: The zany secretary and press agent to Fred Astaire's character, participating in the famous 'Stiff Upper Lip' funhouse dance number.
filmography.plot: An American dancer in London falls for a noblewoman, but her family and staff try to keep them apart.

filmography.title: International House
filmography.role_description: A nurse who accompanies the Doctor (George Burns) and befuddles the hotel guests with her nonsensical logic.
filmography.plot: Various eccentrics converge on a hotel in China to bid on the rights to a new television-like invention.

filmography.title: Six of a Kind
filmography.role_description: A woman traveling cross-country with her husband, sharing the car with another couple to cut costs.
filmography.plot: Two couples share a car on a trip across the country and get involved in a bank robbery investigation.

filmography.title: The Big Broadcast
filmography.role_description: A radio station employee who confuses everyone she encounters.
filmography.plot: A radio station manager facing bankruptcy tries to save his station by putting on a star-studded show.

filmography.title: We're Not Dressing
filmography.role_description: An eccentric wealthy woman shipwrecked on a desert island with her husband and friends.
filmography.plot: A yacht carrying a spoiled heiress and her friends crashes on a desert island, forcing them to rely on a sailor for survival.

filmography.title: Many Happy Returns
filmography.role_description: The dizzy daughter of a department store owner who is married off to George Burns to get her out of the way.
filmography.plot: A father pays a man to marry his scatterbrained daughter to get her off his hands.

filmography.title: College Humor
filmography.role_description: A college student who provides comedic interludes with George Burns.
filmography.plot: A college freshman becomes a football star but struggles with his studies and romance.

filmography.title: Honolulu
filmography.role_description: The dizzy friend of the female lead who accompanies her to Hawaii.
filmography.plot: A famous movie star switches places with a Hawaiian plantation owner who looks exactly like him.

filmography.title: College Swing
filmography.role_description: A woman who must graduate from college to inherit a fortune, despite being a terrible student.
filmography.plot: A woman must graduate from college to inherit a fortune, leading to a hired tutor and comedic chaos.

filmography.title: Love in Bloom
filmography.role_description: A carnival performer and sister to the female lead.
filmography.plot: A carnival girl tries to find success in New York City and falls for a songwriter.

filmography.title: The Big Broadcast of 1936
filmography.role_description: A character involved in the comedic subplot of a television invention.
filmography.plot: A radio station owner invents a television device to broadcast a singing contest and save his station.

filmography.title: The Big Broadcast of 1937
filmography.role_description: The wife of the radio show sponsor who interferes with the production.
filmography.plot: A radio station manager tries to put on a successful show while dealing with a sponsor and a rival.

filmography.title: College Holiday
filmography.role_description: A woman involved in a hotel's eugenics experiment plot.
filmography.plot: A hotel owner invites college students to her resort for a 'genetic experiment' while trying to save the business.

filmography.title: Here Comes Cookie
filmography.role_description: A wealthy daughter whose father fakes poverty to curb her spending.
filmography.plot: A father pretends to be broke to teach his free-spending daughters a lesson.

filmography.title: Lambchops
filmography.role_description: Her film debut in a short featuring her vaudeville routine with George Burns.
filmography.plot: George Burns and Gracie Allen perform a comedy routine in a dining room setting.

filmography.title: Two Girls and a Sailor
filmography.role_description: A guest appearance performing a comedy routine.
filmography.plot: Two sisters, both singers, fall for the same sailor, but he only has eyes for one of them.

filmography.title: Fit to be Tied
filmography.role_description: A dizzy shopgirl who frustrates a customer in this comedy short.
filmography.plot: A customer in a department store gets increasingly frustrated by a scatterbrained salesclerk.

filmography.title: Pulling a Bone
filmography.role_description: A comedy short featuring the duo in a train station setting.
filmography.plot: George and Gracie engage in their trademark banter at a railway station.

filmography.title: The Antique Shop
filmography.role_description: A confused customer in an antique shop.
filmography.plot: George tries to sell antiques while dealing with Gracie's illogical interruptions.

filmography.title: Once Over, Light
filmography.role_description: A talkative manicurist in a barbershop.
filmography.plot: A barber tries to work while his manicurist engages in confusing conversation.

filmography.title: One Hundred Percent Service
filmography.role_description: A hotel maid who causes chaos for the guests.
filmography.plot: George and Gracie play hotel staff who inadvertently ruin a guest's stay.

filmography.title: Oh, Nerts!
filmography.role_description: A hotel guest who annoys the management.
filmography.plot: A comedy short set in a hotel featuring the duo's classic patter.

filmography.title: Walking the Baby
filmography.role_description: A babysitter who has trouble with a pram in the park.
filmography.plot: George and Gracie get into a comedic argument while taking a baby for a walk.
